content:
Hi,

I've reached out to the teaching assistants and after some work, they recommended that I reach out here:

The test file is not reading my hangman function, and despite my game working as per the instructions, the autograder scored my pset @ 80%

would you kindly advise on what could be the issue and rectify the grade if my submission is correct? 

hangman.py [my submission]
subject: test file not reading my hangman function

content: Hi, I ran your code locally on my laptop, and it ran, but was failing 3 tests (all 3 of the play game tests). I'm not entirely sure why you weren't able to run the test file. Can you send in the error message you got?

Hi,

That's the issue we couldn't get around during the office hours--despite the game running as per the instructions on my Spyder interface, the test fails to read it

Also current problems I have found in your code:

- your don't print the word guesses when telling the player how many guesses they have left

- you still display already guessed incorrect letters in the letters available

- if the player loses, you always print out 'The word was else'

- you do not print dashes before the winning statement

- The way you deal with revealing letters is incorrect... there is a statement that says 'Letter revealed: a', for instance if you are revealing the letter a, that your program does not print.

When I fixed all these issues locally, your code passed all tests. Let me know if it does the same for you
